text: One of my all-time favorite trick is
something I like to call the negativity
sandwich
this trick is useful in any scenario in
which you need to tell someone something
negative it could be a friend was asking
you for some constructive criticism on
his art it could be when you have to
break up with your girlfriend
it could be when you have to give an
intervention to your buddy about his
drug problem
all you have to do is say something
positive first then say whatever
negative thing you have to say and then
immediately follow this up with another
positive statement what this does is it
reduces the bad feelings associated with
the negative statement when you're
interacting with others they are
significantly less likely to get
consumed emotionally this is great for
getting constructive points across
without damaging your relationships with
them for example when I was in charge of
the sales team i had an employee was
really good at sales was always late and
when you let one person be late the rest
follow my brought him into my office and
I said Jay you're really good salesman
without a doubt one of the best in the
office you're almost everything i could
ask for
however this constant lateness man if I
keep letting you slide the rest of the
team is going to start slacking to if it
happens again I'm going to have to let
you go
which is something i really don't want
to do because i like you a lot as a
friend and I respect your skills as a
salesperson and I know if you just show
up on time you're going to close a lot
more deals and then you'll be without a
doubt the best salesperson in this
office as you can see right here the
first part of this conversation was very
positive the middle was sort of negative
it was pointing at his faults and i
finished it with another positive
statement and after just talked with him
he was never late again here's another
example a good friend of mine has a drug
problem
this is how I would approach him in
regards to that issue
look Tyler I'm going to be completely
honest with you I think you're really
smart dude some of the things you say
sound like they came right out of a
philosophy textbook i have no doubt no
doubt in my mind that you have two
potential to accomplish anything you
want in life
that this constant abuse man it's
ruining your life you're losing the
respect of people around you are having
issues with woman you're accomplishing a
lot less than what you're capable of
you're a drug addict if you just focus
your time and energy on something
productive i'm sure you can do anything
that you like I really do think you're
smarter than half the guys I hang out
with you have a lot of potential Tyler a
lot
don't let drugs take that from you again
you can clearly see the first part of
this conversation is very positive the
middle is negative and the last part of
the conversation is again positive the
reason the negativity sandwich works so
well is because you're providing
positive emotions at the beginning and
ending of an event people are more
likely to remember the beginning and
endings of certain events so when they
look back at the conversation that you
had don't think of it in a very positive
light you'll say wow you know that was a
very constructive conversation and
they'll think about the things you said
however when you don't do this some
people will take it the wrong way and
they'll take it as a personal insult you
feel like the whole conversation itself
was just- district has helped me through
a lot of critical conversations in my
life so I hope you guys found some value
in this short little video
besides that stay tuned
